solution_line_template: Since there was a {discount_percentage}% discount, this means that Solomon only paid {total_percentage}% - {discount_percentage}% = {percentage_paid}% of the original price.
The {percentage_paid}% is represented by ${sale_price}, so 1% is equal to ${sale_price}/{percentage_paid} = $<<{sale_price}/{percentage_paid}={value_per_percent}>>{value_per_percent}.

Therefore, the original price of the dining table is ${value_per_percent} x {total_percentage_for_original_price} =$<<{value_per_percent}*{total_percentage_for_original_price}={original_price}>>{original_price}.
